column4: How can I check what architecture my PC is? I know it's i686, but i have a SMP kernel installed, and i don't know why... i'm confused, and i need to run a game but it has multiple architectures.. anyone?
that's i686. Don't worry about the smp kernel - it won't break anything.
which version of ubuntu are you running? The latest versions use smp by default.
i686 will be a bit faster than i386.
you don't need it, but it won't make any difference - an smp kernel on a non-smp system will simply not use the smp features.
but the SMP version of the game -DID- run..
yeah, it will do... smp won't break anything, as I say. I'm not even sure why there's an smp version of the game - that's unusual.
thanks for your help. See ya :)
the smp kernel is just a standard kernel with smp features enabled, but on a non-smp system it'll function exactly like a non-smp kernel.
